49/* Common utility functions */
50
51/*%
52 * Extract the network address part from a "struct sockaddr".
53 * \brief
54 * The address family is given explicitly
55 * instead of using src->sa_family, because the latter does not work
56 * for copying a network mask obtained by SIOCGIFNETMASK (it does
57 * not have a valid address family).
58 */
59
60static void
61get_addr(unsigned int family, isc_netaddr_t *dst, struct sockaddr *src,
62 char *ifname)
63{
64 struct sockaddr_in6 *sa6;
65
66#if !defined(HAVE_IF_NAMETOINDEX)
67 UNUSED(ifname);
68#endif
69
70 /* clear any remaining value for safety */
71 memset(dst, 0, sizeof(*dst));
72
73 dst->family = family;
74 switch (family) {
75 case AF_INET:
76 memmove(&dst->type.in,
77 &((struct sockaddr_in *) src)->sin_addr,
78 sizeof(struct in_addr));
79 break;
80 case AF_INET6:
81 sa6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)src;
82 memmove(&dst->type.in6, &sa6->sin6_addr,
83 sizeof(struct in6_addr));
84 if (sa6->sin6_scope_id != 0)
85 isc_netaddr_setzone(dst, sa6->sin6_scope_id);
86 else {
87 /*
88 * BSD variants embed scope zone IDs in the 128bit
89 * address as a kernel internal form. Unfortunately,
90 * the embedded IDs are not hidden from applications
91 * when getting access to them by sysctl or ioctl.
92 * We convert the internal format to the pure address
93 * part and the zone ID part.
94 * Since multicast addresses should not appear here
95 * and they cannot be distinguished from netmasks,
96 * we only consider unicast link-local addresses.
97 */
98 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&sa6->sin6_addr)) {
99 uint16_t zone16;
100
101 memmove(&zone16, &sa6->sin6_addr.s6_addr[2],
102 sizeof(zone16));
103 zone16 = ntohs(zone16);
104 if (zone16 != 0) {
105 /* the zone ID is embedded */
106 isc_netaddr_setzone(dst,
107 (uint32_t)zone16);
108 dst->type.in6.s6_addr[2] = 0;
109 dst->type.in6.s6_addr[3] = 0;
110#ifdef HAVE_IF_NAMETOINDEX
111 } else if (ifname != NULL) {
112 unsigned int zone;
113
114 /*
115 * sin6_scope_id is still not provided,
116 * but the corresponding interface name
117 * is know. Use the interface ID as
118 * the link ID.
119 */
120 zone = if_nametoindex(ifname);
121 if (zone != 0) {
122 isc_netaddr_setzone(dst,
123 (uint32_t)zone);
124 }
125#endif
126 }
127 }
128 }
129 break;
130 default:
131 INSIST(0);
132 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
133 }
134}
135
136/*
137 * Include system-dependent code.
138 */
139
140#ifdef __linux
141#define ISC_IF_INET6_SZ \
142 sizeof("00000000000000000000000000000001 01 80 10 80 XXXXXXloXXXXXXXX\n")
143static isc_result_t linux_if_inet6_next(isc_interfaceiter_t *);
144static isc_result_t linux_if_inet6_current(isc_interfaceiter_t *);
145static void linux_if_inet6_first(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter);
146#endif
147
148#include "ifiter_getifaddrs.c"
149
150#ifdef __linux
151static void
152linux_if_inet6_first(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter) {
153 if (iter->proc != NULL) {
154 rewind(iter->proc);
155 (void)linux_if_inet6_next(iter);
156 } else
157 iter->valid = ISC_R_NOMORE;
158}
159
160static isc_result_t
161linux_if_inet6_next(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter) {
162 if (iter->proc != NULL &&
163 fgets(iter->entry, sizeof(iter->entry), iter->proc) != NULL)
164 iter->valid = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
165 else
166 iter->valid = ISC_R_NOMORE;
167 return (iter->valid);
168}
169
170static isc_result_t
171linux_if_inet6_current(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter) {
172 char address[33];
173 char name[IF_NAMESIZE+1];
174 struct in6_addr addr6;
175 unsigned int ifindex, prefix, flag3, flag4;
176 int res;
177 unsigned int i;
178
179 if (iter->valid != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
180 return (iter->valid);
181 if (iter->proc == NULL) {
182 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
183 ISC_LOGMODULE_INTERFACE, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
184 "/proc/net/if_inet6:iter->proc == NULL");
185 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
186 }
187
188 res = sscanf(iter->entry, "%32[a-f0-9] %x %x %x %x %16s\n",
189 address, &ifindex, &prefix, &flag3, &flag4, name);
190 if (res != 6) {
191 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
192 ISC_LOGMODULE_INTERFACE, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
193 "/proc/net/if_inet6:sscanf() -> %d (expected 6)",
194 res);
195 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
196 }
197 if (strlen(address) != 32) {
198 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
199 ISC_LOGMODULE_INTERFACE, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
200 "/proc/net/if_inet6:strlen(%s) != 32", address);
201 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
202 }
203 for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
204 unsigned char byte;
205 static const char hex[] = "0123456789abcdef";
206 byte = ((strchr(hex, address[i * 2]) - hex) << 4) |
207 (strchr(hex, address[i * 2 + 1]) - hex);
208 addr6.s6_addr[i] = byte;
209 }
210 iter->current.af = AF_INET6;
211 iter->current.flags = INTERFACE_F_UP;
212 isc_netaddr_fromin6(&iter->current.address, &addr6);
213 if (isc_netaddr_islinklocal(&iter->current.address)) {
214 isc_netaddr_setzone(&iter->current.address,
215 (uint32_t)ifindex);
216 }
217 for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
218 if (prefix > 8) {
219 addr6.s6_addr[i] = 0xff;
220 prefix -= 8;
221 } else {
222 addr6.s6_addr[i] = (0xff << (8 - prefix)) & 0xff;
223 prefix = 0;
224 }
225 }
226 isc_netaddr_fromin6(&iter->current.netmask, &addr6);
227 strlcpy(iter->current.name, name, sizeof(iter->current.name));
228 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
229}
230#endif
231
232/*
233 * The remaining code is common to the sysctl and ioctl case.
234 */
235
236isc_result_t
237isc_interfaceiter_current(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter,
238 isc_interface_t *ifdata)
239{
240 REQUIRE(iter->result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
241 memmove(ifdata, &iter->current, sizeof(*ifdata));
242 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
243}
244
245isc_result_t
246isc_interfaceiter_first(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter) {
247 isc_result_t result;
248
249 REQUIRE(VALID_IFITER(iter));
250
251 internal_first(iter);
252 for (;;) {
253 result = internal_current(iter);
254 if (result != ISC_R_IGNORE)
255 break;
256 result = internal_next(iter);
257 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
258 break;
259 }
260 iter->result = result;
261 return (result);
262}
263
264isc_result_t
265isc_interfaceiter_next(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter) {
266 isc_result_t result;
267
268 REQUIRE(VALID_IFITER(iter));
269 REQUIRE(iter->result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
270
271 for (;;) {
272 result = internal_next(iter);
273 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
274 break;
275 result = internal_current(iter);
276 if (result != ISC_R_IGNORE)
277 break;
278 }
279 iter->result = result;
280 return (result);
281}
282
283void
284isc_interfaceiter_destroy(isc_interfaceiter_t **iterp)
285{
286 isc_interfaceiter_t *iter;
287 REQUIRE(iterp != NULL);
288 iter = *iterp;
289 REQUIRE(VALID_IFITER(iter));
290
291 internal_destroy(iter);
292 if (iter->buf != NULL)
293 isc_mem_put(iter->mctx, iter->buf, iter->bufsize);
294
295 iter->magic = 0;
296 isc_mem_put(iter->mctx, iter, sizeof(*iter));
297 *iterp = NULL;
298}
